context.p: Eucalyptus lets you run instances from both Linux-based images (e.g., Ubuntu, RHEL/CentOS, openSUSE, Debian, Fedora, etc.) and Windows-based images (i.e., Windows Server 2003/2008 and Windows 7).

stepresult.p: Eucalyptus returns output similar to the following example.
stepresult.codeblock: RESERVATION r-460007BE alice alice-default INSTANCE i-2F930625 emi-EC1410C1 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 pending mykey 2010-03-29T23:08:45.962Z eki-822C1344 eri-BFA91429

step.cmd: Look for the instance ID in the second column and write it down. In the example above, the instance ID is i-2F930625. You use it to take any action on this instance, including terminating it when you are finished.
Get the launch status of the intance with the euca-describe-instances command.
